author: hangleang.eth
content: Hey there, after grandine facing OOM killed and CPU overload during syncing, I want to check with other clients how you implement block acceptance in the fork choice. Do we require to have all sampling columns to be available to consider whether to accept the block or we can just accept the block then backfill those columns instead?

author: jimmygchen
content: With the current spec, all custody & sampling columns are required before we import the block.

author: hangleang.eth
content: how is LH perform during syncing with columns?

author: jimmygchen
content: We still have a few sync bugs, but we're not noticing any resource issues during sync

author: hangleang.eth
content: Yeah, for Grandine we still need to optimize the request loads (redundant) due to delay block acceptance, leading to resource overload

author: parithosh
content: They were done manually, this was the first time and we didn't really know what we were looking for. So manual was the way to go. No real reason to not script them at this point, besides the ability to ensure the network is truly healthy before starting the next experiment

author: matthewkeil
content: I will not be able to attend today.  Lodestar update is we got nearly complete with a refactor and started looking validator custody.  <@792822129019584562> put up a PR to simplify the validator custody implementation and would love everyone‚Äôs feedback on that.  Will look at implementing validator custody fully after a round of feedback on that PR to get a sense of the direction we should take.

author: parithosh
content: Note, 13/21 of the nodes on the peerdas-devnet-5 network are now full nodes. This is ~61% of the network, a distribution we expect to see on mainnet as well.

author: parithosh
content:
look for the variable: `ethereum_node_cl_supernode_enabled=False`
in this file: 
https://github.com/ethpandaops/peerdas-devnets/blob/master/ansible/inventories/devnet-5/inventory.ini

Or if you're a visual person:
https://dora.peerdas-devnet-5.ethpandaops.io/clients/consensus
(toggle "Supernode peers" to show just full node peers)

author: parithosh
content: we do have an ask though: Dora just fetches the full node peers based on the enr. Is there some way we can verify that nodes are indeed configured to be full nodes? And if so, can each client dev please check their nodes and report back so we don't have bugs?

author: jimmygchen
content: call is on now!

author: dmitriishmatko
content:
Duplicating here if we start withholding of data columns:
Teku current running version missed reconstruction
Latest (from `Nashatyrev/das` branch) can do reconstruction but it has different db structure and requires resync.

author: parithosh
content: <@531934490826768418> can you mention the flag i need to add again please? and i add it to a supernode or a fullnode?

author: jimmygchen
content: `--data-columns-withhold-count=64` (Prysm)

author: jimmygchen
content:
There are also a few test flags in Lighthouse:
- `--malicious-withhold-count` (same as prysm)
- `--delay-block-publishing`
- `--delay-data-column-publishing`

We're also planning to add an `--advertise-false-custody-group-count`, which could serve as a way to withhold columns over RPC.

content: How about i add the prysm flag now, wait 1h, then make my way down the list every hour adding a new flag?

author: jimmygchen
content:
Thanks for joining the call today!  Summary:
- CL teams are continuing to make progress on various fixes and validator custody, with some help from external teams (Base) üî®  
- Gajinder proposed a spec change to simplify validator custody, and teams should review and provide feedback ASAP. üëÄ  
- We had some EL representatives on the call to discuss spec changes. üî•  
- Geth, Nethermind, and EthereumJS will participate in devnet-6. üöÄ  
- **Teams should review the network wrapper change and aim to finalize it in the next 2 days** so that all CL/EL teams can start implementation.üèÉ
- Devnet-5 is running well with full nodes; CL teams should verify that the nodes are indeed set up as full nodes.  
- ethPandaOps will start introducing some chaos into devnet-5.
- Francis from Base created a roadmap document (to replace the readiness checklist). Please review and help update it: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1MXf5zTU58mRj0Yq88EPBP1gCJzWTY9FRfUdpZjcfgqw/edit?tab=t.0  
- **The next breakout call will be on Tuesday at 1400 UTC!**

Notes:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Ng2IrCe28kTt1BnIsjtMlKHq2MHgaja24LhFXSvqfJQ/edit?tab=t.0

author: mininny
content:
Hello everyone! 
I'm Minhyuk from Sunnyside Labs, and we're currently working on running devnets and tests to help with the shipping of peerdas üôÇ 

In the past week, we started running our first devnet test, which was aimed at testing high blob throughput in a controlled network to identify any issues in clients when handling high blob counts(>40).

I'd love to get your comments and thoughts on them. Please let us know what sort of metrics or test scenarios that you'd like to see in the future devnets regarding peerdas and blob usages!
https://testinprod.notion.site/Sunnyside-Devnet-Updates-03-11-1b38fc57f54680d8a35dfa4cfb8b852c

In the result of this devnet, we noticed few findings for `reth`, `besu` and `lodestar`. What would be the best way to get in touch with the corresponding client team regarding these inquiries?

author: parithosh
content:
Great job on the doc! 

minor nit, could you guys use `spamoor` to send blob txs on the network?

<@84562395988508672> do you think they can repurpose your blob analysis playbooks on the xatu data they're collecting? so we can see how the "native" devnet runs vs the one with a lot of blobs?

cc <@360491619402776577> <@758579010027782144>  for blobpool metrics
cc CL client devs for the other asks i guess? maybe <@755590043632140352> can also have a look to see if there's some specific info we need to collect and plan for?

content:
